comments.text: In America, people who lose their jobs also lose their health insurance.  So those people will dramatically cut back on healthcare, like doctor visits and dental care.  If you're a dental hygienist, you're thinking "AI can't replace me", but if the dentist has half as many patients, then the dentist needs half as many dental hygienists.

comments.text: It’s well known in the consulting industry that Deloitte has always paid well below market value so only the most desperate or newest workers accept work from them. When I was consulting, average wages for an analyst was $70k/year. Deloitte paid $50k for the same job.

comments.text: In short, the Roaring 20s are getting an AI remake.
comments.author: @keeblebrox

comments.text:
The Jetsons addressed this , they had a running gag that Jim Jetsons boss was over working him because he worked 10 minutes over his 1 day a week job.

The idea is that the worker is protected and paid to ensure they can live the ‘American Dream’, have a home, a family and a holiday.


Then we threw it all away in the 1980’s and 50 years later a significant number of people are looking down the barrel of a financial/AI gun.
comments.author: @marcredsell2622

comments.text:
What's really striking is that the technology exists, progress is being made. But the level of investment is just absurd. This is technology that in 20 years of persistent, cautious development will change everything. 

Instead, they're hyperscaling and hyping themselves up that everything's going to change next year.
comments.author: @NinjaMan47

comments.text:
The AI bubble bursting could actually lead to full systemic change. This is definitely one of those times it is better to let the existing system burn. 
Much like a civil war, no one will like the time during which the mad king is deposed but the survivors will see a better tomorrow. 

Like how Jefferson thought the only way to cure systemic corruption is to have a revolution, hence his 2nd amendment. 
The economy tends to only improve and get enough safeguards creating upwards momentum when companies collapse and are allowed to die. No bailouts, no manipulation to maintain the status quo and if it happens directly maybe involving that 2nd amendment, no army protection.
comments.author: @liamnehren

comments.text: The Luddites were right all along.
comments.author: @JARV9701

comments.text: And then this : employees who use AI burn out more than those who don't. When AI takes over some of your tasks it doesn't mean you get to go home earlier. When the AI finishes a task you still need to fix and process the result, in addition to the other tasks you took on in parallel. Do this too long and you burn out. AI doesn't reduce your workload, it increases it.
comments.author: @Not_An_Expert
